trans-unit.note: (poterminology) uh-tutorial/tutorial.pot (43) (poterminology) uh/unknownhorizons.pot (10) I added 'installer' cause in my opinion, you cannot build a weaver...french will understand that

(poterminology) uh-tutorial/tutorial.pot (13) (poterminology) uh/unknownhorizons.pot (1) I think that tab is not the good word in some case, i had here some other words i used in the tuto translation, seblabel

(poterminology) uh-tutorial/tutorial.pot (11) (poterminology) uh/unknownhorizons.pot (2) Woodcutter will be translated by bucheron. Lumberjack is difficult to translate because it is not just cutting trees...

(poterminology) uh-tutorial/tutorial.pot (4) (poterminology) uh/unknownhorizons.pot (1) In the tutorial context, i often used 'bateau marchand' which can be translated in trading-ship. Why not "marchand indépendant" ?
(poterminology) uh-tutorial/tutorial.pot (1) (poterminology) uh/unknownhorizons.pot (1) Of course, here is all about context cause run can also be translated by 'courir' (using legs for running !)
(poterminology) uh-tutorial/tutorial.pot (4) (poterminology) uh/unknownhorizons.pot (1) tisserand is really more beautifull than tisseur, isn't it ?
(poterminology) uh-tutorial/tutorial.pot (1) (poterminology) uh/unknownhorizons.pot (2) see lamb. wool come from sheep, lambs give meat

(poterminology) uh-tutorial/tutorial.pot (1) (poterminology) uh/unknownhorizons.pot (1) Of course, here is all about context cause run can also be translated by 'courir' (using legs for running !) 75%
